programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The team is thrown into a highly political case after four members of the Taliban are shot and one is kidnapped in New York with no record of their entrance into the country; OA struggles to open up to Gemma about his past in Afghanistan.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When a truck driver is murdered and the drug he was transporting goes missing, the team hunts for those behind the remaining batch that is already wreaking havoc on the streets of New York.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The Somalian terrorist group behind the death of Agent Hobbs resurfaces, sending the team on a chase to take them down for good.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When a bus explosion kills several innocent people, the team jumps into action to take down the responsible terrorist organization; Scola tries to balance fatherhood with the job.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After the president of the NY Fed is gunned down trying to help a young woman in peril, the team races to find the killer and the missing woman.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Hammer's on-again off-again flame is a Broadway star named Linda Fortunato, but her latest role is as primary suspect in the murder investigation of her ex-husband and co-star. The whole city is convinced of her guilt after the spatting couple was seen fighting during rehearsals, but Mike Hammer is determined to clear her name. Drama and mystery unfold while Hammer investigates a whole cast of suspects.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: After being released from his time in prison, Mike Hammer's old friend Herman Simpson joins him for dinner. The discussion turns techie when Simpson brings up the computer revolution that is underway. However, a bank robbery involving this same technology-- and a suspiciously similar criminal --takes place the same evening. Simpson becomes the prime suspect, and Hammer is his only hope at staying free.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mike's journalist friend, Pete, misses their scheduled meeting. But the apparent suicide raises questions that lead Mike to follow up on Pete's latest investigative assignment, an exposé on surveillance. Hammer finds out that Pete was writing about the shadows and powers behind modern surveillance, an entity known as Big Brother. Now Hammer must track down the killer that's always watching everybody.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Deputy Mayor Barry Lawrence may be running for District Attorney on a "law and order" platform, but that doesn't mean that his conduct is always above board. When his mistress Tracy calls, she puts him in a compromising position. The police investigation stalls in what appears to be an attempt to cover up for the man Tracy's parents believe killed her--Barry Lawrence. Mike loves the idea of getting dirt on Barry, but a brawl with a cop leaves him conducting his investigation--with the help of his team--from a jail cell.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The NCIS team partners with the FBI to locate a terrorist cell in Los Angeles believed to be preparing for an imminent attack.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team continues to search for a terrorist cell in Los Angeles; Callen and Sam remain trapped in a movie theater after multiple bombs have detonated, and every remaining exit is wired with explosives.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates the murder of a journalist who was writing an exposé on a mishandled classified military operation; as their wedding day quickly approaches, Kensi and Deeks work on the last remaining items on their to-do list.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: After months of planning, the NCIS family celebrates the wedding of Kensi and Deeks; an old acquaintance pays Deeks a surprise visit on his wedding day.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Sydney turns to her sister Nell for help after her high school crush gets mixed up in a Russian plot to steal intelligence from the Department of Defense; Special Prosecutor John Rogers conducts mandatory performance reviews with the team.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: As Firehouse 51 welcomes a new member to the team, whose presence could provide some complications, Brett's leadership shines during a scary call; Boden sees great potential in Kidd and proposes an idea that could have lasting repercussions.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Brett and Mackey find their lives in peril; Casey and Brett tread in unfamiliar territory; Severide chases a memory while Kidd adeptly solves a firehouse problem; Ritter puts himself in harm's way during a harrowing call.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: A mishap on the aerial ladder in the midst of a fire rescue leaves Mouch shaken and questioning his abilities; Kidd looks for support from Severide while Casey and Brett discuss their future.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: While completing a task assigned by headquarters, Boden makes an unforeseen connection; Gallo is forced to make a surprise rescue of one of their own when the firehouse is called to the site of a construction explosion; Mouch reignites an old feud.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: When Firehouse 51 is called to the scene of a dangerous blaze inside a 10-story storage unit, Herrmann and Cruz find themselves trapped inside a freight elevator with all communications cut off.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Gallo makes a split-second decision during a dangerous fire rescue, leaving Casey steaming that his direct orders weren't obeyed; Kidd feels a strain in her relationship with Severide; Brett and Mackey search for answers after some suspicious calls.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: A fire at a homeless encampment leaves Severide and Casey searching for answers; Cruz is shaken up after a close call; Ritter lends a helping hand to a victim.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: A call to a familiar location brings back mixed emotions for Severide; Herrmann heads out for a vacation; Casey is not thrilled with his replacement.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Mouch, Gallo, Ritter and Mackey report for training; a nasty blow to the head brings Casey unimaginable pain.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: A series of suspicious fires sends 51 on a search for the cause; Casey continues down a troubling path; Mouch is looking to make his long-awaited dream come true.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: A new recruit with ties to the CFD tests Serveride's patience; Violet receives a mysterious note that sends her and Brett on a hunt for the person who wrote it.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: While Mouch makes an incredible save, all eyes are on a mystery man who helped save his neighbor; Casey worries about his future at the CFD.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: A mysterious caller who is in danger relies on Kidd to help save her and her brother; the firehouse helps Cruz get ready for fatherhood.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: A fire breaks out at a pet food factory, and Casey and Severide help the owner, Pete, get to the bottom of it; the annual garage sale takes place at 51 and everyone is on edge.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Severide and Casey try to find the best fit for Kidd; Ritter, Gallo and Violet help plan an event for Mouch.

programme.desc: The murder of a computer hacker prompts an investigation, and McGarrett tries to stage a reunion.

programme.desc: McGarrett and a little girl are taken hostage by an armed man (Tom Arnold) during a camping trip with Grace; Kono meets Adam's brother, who was recently released from prison.

programme.desc: Three teenagers die from drug overdose, and Danny sets out to find their narcotic source and bring the responsible to justice.

programme.desc: The family questions Erin's tactics when she tries to take down a gang leader by using his law-abiding brother as bait.

programme.desc: Erin becomes the subject of a personal and deadly vendetta when a reviled rapist and murderer she put away is released from jail.

programme.desc: Mitrione wavers on whether he can fight, sparking speculation that Kimbo will return to the Octagon. Justin Wren and Roy Nelson square off in the first quarterfinal fight.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Questions continue about whether Matt Mitrione will fight, prompting a visit from Dana. Kimbo battles an injury with hopes of returning as a replacement. Teammates Brendan Schaub and Jon Madsen face off in the second Quarterfinal fight.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Dana talks to Kimbo about replacing Mitrione. Marcus Jones unleashes his rage outside the cage. The last two quarterfinals are fought, followed by the semifinal announcements.

programme.title: TUF 10 Finale: TUF 10 Finale
programme.desc: The Ultimate Fighter: Heavyweights Finale saw the colossal collision between finalists Brendan 'The Hybrid' Schaub and Roy 'Big Country' Nelson. Also in action, Jon Jones vs. Matt Hamill, Frankie Edgar vs. Matt Veach, and the Octagon debut of Kimbo Slice.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Sixteen European fighters and sixteen American fighters arrive in Las Vegas to fight for a chance at fulfilling their dreams of entering the UFC. Representing countries such as Russia, Sweden, France, and England, the Europeans face off against each other in the most important bouts of their lives. The fighters from all across America are paired as well, and the winners of all matches will move on to form Team McGregor and Team Faber and compete for a six-figure contract with the UFC and a Harley Davidson motorcycle. Coaching the US team is former WEC champion and owner of Team Alpha Male, Urijah Faber, and coaching the European team is current interim featherweight champion Conor McGregor.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Shortly after a coin toss decided which team would get to pick the first preliminary fight, coach Conor McGregor gathers the European fighters and delivers a prepared speech outlining what his team can expect this season. That night, the winning European and American fighters move into the TUF house. After scoping out their new digs and picking their rooms, a celebratory barbecue ensues. Eager to turn their focus to the competition, the fighters waste no time in starting to size up the competition and new friendships are forged.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: The tension rises as Conor tries to get under Faber's skin and dares him to fight TJ Dillashaw. Germany's Sascha Sharma steps into the octagon to face Chris Gruetzemacher in the second preliminary fight. A coach completely loses it as he watches the fight unfold.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Urijah and Conor argue over coaching styles. A member of Team Faber skips practice. American Tom Gallicchio faces off against Poland's Marcin Wrzosek in the third preliminary match of the competition.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: The pressure of the competition starts to weigh on one of the fighters as Urijah and Conor prepare for the fourth preliminary fight featuring two hungry young competitors. Both teams get a chance to relax during a night out with the coaches.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: An unorthodox fighter from Team Faber faces one of the top competitors of Team Europe in the fifth preliminary fight of the season. UFC bantamweight champion TJ Dillashaw arrives to help Uriah. When Conor calls him a traitor all hell breaks lose.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Two members of Team Faber come face to face in a drunken confrontation at the house. An explosive and highly anticipated American fighter steps into the octagon to face off against a very tough European opponent in the sixth preliminary fight.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: In an action-packed two fight episode, the seventh preliminary fight pits a hard-hitting striker from Team McGregor against an American brawler. Then, two more warriors step into the octagon for the eighth preliminary fight.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: McGregor and Faber face off in the coaches' challenge. An American fighter gets ready to take on one of the most experienced European fighters in the ninth and final preliminary fight. Conor and Urijah argue over the quarterfinal match ups and who will be left out of the competition.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: An unexpected turn of events brings a fighter back into the competition. A European powerhouse goes head to head with a Team Faber fighter in the first quarterfinal, and two experienced fighters face off in a match of strength vs. technique in the second quarterfinal fight.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Two hard-hitting teammates battle it out in the third quarterfinal fight. Then, a crafty veteran from Team McGregor faces off against one of Team Faber's most dynamic fighters in the fourth and final quarterfinal matchup.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Conor is shocked when he finds out that Team USA coach Urijah Faber has brought in current UFC Featherweight champion Jose Aldo as a guest coach. Then it's the semifinal fights, with a spot in the live finale in Las Vegas on the line.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Uriah's attitude ignites a blowup, causing a major rift in Team Sonnen. While the fighters battle it out in a night of bowling, Jon and Chael raise the stakes in a game of their own. Then Josh Samman takes on Tor Troeng in the fifth preliminary fight.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: One fighter cuts loose and another alienates himself while the others hit Hooters. Josh Samman's recurring leg pain lands him in the hospital. Cop-turned-fighter Jimmy Quinlan faces Team Jones first pick Clint Hester in the sixth Preliminary Fight.

programme.title: All In - Atlas 2022
programme.desc: All in provides unbridled access to selected PLL teams – beginning with the squad's leader, the Head Coach. We cover on the field, in the locker room, and behind the scenes access through wins + losses.

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome back to episode #17 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon on TLN! Notre dame is OUT. Matt Traynor and the Nittany Lions stun the Irish. Doogs reflects. CUSE IS BACK. Joey Spallina and Syracuse finally get the monkey off their back and are heading to Foxborough. Should Joey have gotten the Tewaaraton invite? Death, taxes, and Maryland in the final four. Does Maryland need to win one more to cement Coach Tillman's legacy? Lacrosse announcing LEGEND Eamon McEneaney joins the pod! The boys go over his most legendary calls. Eamon gives media member Mitch tips on how to be better in the booth. We round out the show with start, bench, cut, lacrosse final four sites.

programme.desc: Atlas vs Chrome from July 29, 2023

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome back to episode #17 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon on TLN! Notre dame is OUT. Matt Traynor and the Nittany Lions stun the Irish. Doogs reflects. CUSE IS BACK. Joey Spallina and Syracuse finally get the monkey off their back and are heading to Foxborough. Should Joey have gotten the Tewaaraton invite? Death, taxes, and Maryland in the final four. Does Maryland need to win one more to cement Coach Tillman's legacy? Lacrosse announcing LEGEND Eamon McEneaney joins the pod! The boys go over his most legendary calls. Eamon gives media member Mitch tips on how to be better in the booth. We round out the show with start, bench, cut, lacrosse final four sites.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #6: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Masashi Oya is the chip leader ahead of Matthew Wantman, Justin Saliba, Martin Zamani, Jared Jaffee, Ken Aldridge, Anthony Hu, Jesse Lonis, and Dan Shak, as the final nine players play for the $223,100 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Just 50 players return on Day 6 of the WSOP Main Event as Marcel Luske headlines the feature table along with John Murphy. On the outer tables, Josh Arieh and David Williams begin their run up the leaderboard, while previous champions Chris Ferguson and Dan Harrington remain in contention as just 32 players remain.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: There are 32 players remaining on Day 6 of the WSOP Main Event. Chip leader Greg Raymer headlines the feature table along with Josh Arieh and Dan Harrington. The elimination of Chris Ferguson leaves Harrington as the sole Main Event champion remaining, while the field is reduced to just 17 players.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The WSOP Main Event plays down to the final table as former champion Dan Harrington, along with Dutchman Marcel Luske look to make a run at being one of the final nine. Plenty of others will fall short, but who will reach the 2004 WSOP Main Event final table?

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The final table of the 2004 WSOP Main Event sees Greg Raymer hold the chip lead ahead of Matt Dean, Josh Arieh, Glenn Hughes, Dan Harrington, David Williams, Al Krux, Mike McLain, and Mattias Andersson. All eyes are on the $5 million first-place pirze and the title of 2004 World Champion.

programme.title: Concealment 2: Open Marriage
programme.desc: A couple open their marriage to their friend Isis. After Isis betrays them and steals their money, secret affairs lead to tragic consequences.

programme.title: Cougar
programme.desc: In suburban Atlanta, Donna's son Brandon bonds with a mysterious new neighbor. As their connection turns deadly, Donna races to save him.

programme.title: Kiss Me Once
programme.desc: Gabrielle, a delusional romantic, fixates on anyone who shows her the slightest interest. Her obsession turns dangerous when her feelings aren't reciprocated.

programme.title: My Husband's Mistress
programme.desc: Behind the glamorous facade of the aviation industry, a dirty betrayal unfolds. A devoted wife's world is shattered when she discovers her husband's affair with her best friend. As the truth unravels, a battle for love, revenge, and survival ensues.

programme.title: The Wait Game
programme.desc: Yolanda Hills, a woman deeply in love with her longtime partner Jonas Jones, has been patiently awaiting their wedding day. Their idyllic relationship takes a terrifying turn when a home intruder invades their peaceful sanctuary. Held captive in her own home, Yolanda is confronted with a shocking revelation that will forever alter the course of their lives.

programme.title: Cuzzo
programme.desc: After a number of failed attempts to pass on his bloodline, a wealthy businessman makes the grave mistake of asking his cousin to impregnate his wife.

programme.title: Cuffin Season
programme.desc: When Nate's livelihood becomes dependent on his marital status, he makes it his mission to find a wife in a city where most are single.

programme.title: Conflict of Interest
programme.desc: When Mickey (Christopher McDonald) returns to the police force after a long hiatus, he has his sights set on shady businessman Gideon (Judd Nelson). Everyone knows that Gideon peddles drugs and sex and sells stolen cars. When Mickey's son, Jason (Gregory Alan Harris), is framed for murder, Mickey is set to prove that Gideon is behind it all. In his search for justice and revenge, Mickey is willing to do anything, and he's determined to shut Gideon down forever.

programme.title: Complex
programme.desc: The disappearance of a woman and the murder of another leads to the investigation of four different families, living inside of one apartment complex.

programme.title: Redemption
programme.desc: Lost and grieving, Chris seeks solace in the wrong crowd. A chance encounter with the enigmatic Patrick leads him down a dangerous path, forcing him to confront his own morality and the consequences of his choices.

programme.title: Scandalous
programme.desc: Lady Watts, a bestselling author, reveals secrets about her affairs with those closest to her in her latest memoir. At her launch party, a heated argument turns violent, and she's left unconscious. As detectives investigate, secrets, love triangles, and betrayal emerge. The search for the attacker leads to twists and turns, involving everyone from her talent manager to her labelmate. The truth about the night of the attack is slowly revealed, with unexpected consequences for all involved.

programme.title: Sweet Mahogany 3: The Final Entanglement
programme.desc: The lives of Mahogany Andrews and those around her are drastically changed after devastating news changes relationships and reveals dark secrets from the past that will have a major impact on everyone's future.

programme.title: She's Watching
programme.desc: After finally moving into their dream home together, a young couple finds that they’re being watched every night by an obsessed neighbor.

programme.title: The Honeymoon
programme.desc: Humiliated by her best friend and ex-fiancé's affair, Summer seeks revenge by sabotaging their honeymoon, but her plan unravels.

programme.title: Bruised 2
programme.desc: Two years after the death of her husband, Kayla Brown has rebuilt her life following the launch of her successful memoir. she is then visited by a stalker, who is hell-bent on making her pay for what she has done in order to escape her husband.

programme.title: Aliens in the Hood
programme.desc: The hood politics of the neighborhood become even more complicated after the arrival of aliens. When one man in the neighborhood is blessed with superpowers, he and the other warring factions are headed to war over control of the current drug trade.

programme.title: The Struggle
programme.desc: A young husband's descent into alcoholism threatens his marriage.

programme.title: Street Dreams: Los Angeles
programme.desc: An undercover cop with the LAPD stumbles upon a domestic terrorism case that could land him a position in the FBI’s counterintelligence division.

programme.title: Stick Up
programme.desc: Two old friends from high school who’ve decided to enter into the drug and sex trade begin to groom a pair of women to work under them.

programme.title: Surviving the Storm
programme.desc: An advanced-stage breast cancer diagnosis for a 28-year-old single mom rallies her estranged sisters together to confront their family's dark past.

programme.title: The Queens Ball
programme.desc: A ruthless queenpin prepares for her 50th birthday party, unaware that she's the target of an assassination plot. Will her big day become a bloodbath?

programme.title: Nowhere to be Found
programme.desc: Two sisters go on a senior trip to Mexico, led by Ava's boyfriend Trent. Journalist Jessica Vandross is going to the same Mexican town in search of her sister's killer after escaping a sex trafficking ring. These stories collide, in a thrilling fight for their lives.

programme.title: The Jealous Son
programme.desc: A woman falls for her boyfriend's charismatic son, and soon finds herself entangled in a dangerous obsession.

programme.title: But I'm Married
programme.desc: Kimora, a top home designer, and Jamal, a construction mogul, tackle the twists of marriage and temptation in their bustling careers.

programme.title: Shotlanta
programme.desc: Mozzy moves from Jamaica to Atlanta, rising in the drug trade to lift his family from poverty, but faces challenges that test his loyalty.

programme.title: The Isiah Factor Uncensored
programme.desc: News anchor and reporter Isiah Carey tackles hot-button news issues with a no-holds-barred attitude.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A woman asks Josh, an old friend, to help find her husband Frank - a bounty hunter out to settle a score. He wants to catch a young outlaw who shot him in the leg.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When Randall has a sheriff bed a prisoner, the man's gang kidnaps the sheriff and two others and threatens to kill one per day until the man is freed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: In Mexico, Josh is hired to protect a man and his pregnant wife from his the villagers who are angered when he refuses the town healing woman or "witch" from being present when his wife gives birth.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: After Josh takes the task of finding a man and his wife's pet ewe, he becomes the butt of many jokes while cattlemen nearly hang him when he mentions sheep. His only clue is a gold bell the ewe wore.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When a convicted killer escapes prison, Josh is hired to protect the woman whose testimony put him there. The woman's husband is a lawyer who says he has always been a coward and never carries a gun.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides into a town looking for a man who wants to hire him. When he goes to the man's room at the hotel, Josh is shot. He must figure out who shot him but the sheriff is ordering him out of town.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by Harry Weaver to track down his twin brother Pete, a wanted man. Harry is tired of being used by Pete, plus the law and bounty hunters are apt to mistake him for Pete.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is called in to track down a new outlaw, the local sheriff who is a friend. The good sheriff who was seduced into robbing a bank by his girlfriend, convinces Josh to let him assist in her capture

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting a deaf teenage girl and keeping everyone off the father's place for a day or two. Although initially bored, Josh starts to develop a relationship with the friendly girl.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh escorts a photographer to take a picture of his friend El Gato, who is a hilarious bandit living in the hills of Mexico with a small army. However, El Gato is new to photographs and leery.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A broke Josh is hired by a fearful man to help him elope with his sweetheart, Jane, the daughter of a local rancher. The girl's father is vehemently opposed to the marriage.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting an express office employee who stole $10,000 and wants to return it before it's discovered missing. However, he had an accomplice and does not know where the accomplice is.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A Japanese woman travels to the U.S. to find a man who proposed to her and hires Josh to find him since no one will help her. Josh is confronted by the Japanese man to whom she had been promised.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in town thinking the sheriff summoned him to go after a man. Instead, a woman wants Josh to bring in the man, her wanted husband, alive, so he can prove self defense.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides to Barney Durant's horse business right after Barney pushes his son to leave. When Josh's prisoners escape taking 2 horses from his horse trader friend, he helps in tracking them down.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: While pursuing Carl Martin, Josh stops at a marshal's office and is falsely accused of the marshal's murder.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When phony wanted posters seek a retired Confederate officer, Colonel Sykes' daughter summons Josh to help.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Randall is rooked into advancing half the bounty to a man who promises to lead him to Shawnee Bill.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are ready for Halloween, despite a leaky roof that forces Dan and Louise to cancel their honeymoon

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene worries about Mark making friends at his new school; Mark turns to Ben for advice; Becky finds herself thriving in college and starts thinking about her future plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie devises an offbeat plan to serve the customers at The Lunch Box, it's anything but smooth; Dan begins to sell furniture to make room for his new bride and her things.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Louise starts to move in, Dan decides to sell the furniture he bought for Roseanne when they were married; he soon finds parting with the furniture harder than he thought.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene brings Nick to the hardware store, where they run into Ben, who invites Nick to join him at The Lunch Box to watch a Bears game.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners celebrate Mark when he makes Dean's List at his new magnet school; Jackie continues to navigate her relationship with Neville.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues to navigate her breakup with Ben; Dan offers to talk with Aldo's dad when he doesn't approve of Harris and Aldo's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark returns to public school and finds it hard to fit in; Darlene isn't happy when she finds out what Mark's doing to make extra cash for college.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene loves the house she's looking at, but when the realtor says she has a chance of getting the house if she's part of a couple, she convinces Ben to pretend to be her partner.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The family is locked down in their home due to a shooting incident in the neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky outs her relationship with Professor Davis, it's his erratic behavior that sends Becky down a path to reevaluate their relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene searches for a home that she and Becky can afford; after an attempt to boost business at The Lunch Box goes awry.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan enlists a few friends to help him with the funeral home remodel; Robin and Darlene take a big career risk.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to cope with the stress of construction; Lou returns as Mark's contrabassoon teacher.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: In an effort to save money, Darlene and Ben, and Jackie and Neville head off on their joint honeymoon, where their cost-saving measures contribute to a tension-filled getaway.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Jackie moves in with Neville, he shows up to their home with an excess of animals from his vet office; Darlene and Ben argue Darlene is turning into her father.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is anxious to get his driver's license; Darlene attempts to teach Mark to drive, but her frantic energy sends him running to Ben for help; Harris meets a new guy online.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When a relative passes away unexpectedly, the family must debate about who should gain custody of a jaded nephew, who is just shy of his 18th birthday.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Problems arise on Beverly Rose's first day of kindergarten; Becky and Darlene have a disagreement.

programme.title: Ian Harvie: May the Best Cock Win
programme.desc: Ian Harvie is not quite the kind of man you might think. He's redefining what it means to be a dude through a fresh perspective on sex/sexuality with some seriously funny and new kinds of dick jokes. Unafraid to quip about subjects no other comedian has ever touched, Ian’s performance challenges the traditionally macho, sex-obsessed world of stand up in ways you won’t believe, proving that laughter cuts across all identities and ultimately unites us all in MAY THE BEST COCK WIN. Oh and, Ian is the world's first trans man comedian with a stand up comedy special.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow
programme.desc: Another episode of the game show in which 50 members of the public compete - with almost no chance of winning.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Can magician Darren run the travellator and cross the Big Red Balls?

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Today’s courageous band of volunteers include a former world class athlete intent on making a comeback.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: The Winter Blob makes a welcome appearance to send the contestants into orbit whilst Granny’s House.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Tonight, twenty brave battlers will take on the wintry weirdness.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.desc: Monty sows rocket, harvests chillies and tomatoes, and demonstrates how to take semi-ripe cuttings. Frances Tophill meets a head gardener in south London who's started gardening sustainably.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty undertakes more seasonal jobs at Longmeadow. Arit Anderson meets a garden designer in Somerset who has worked in harmony with nature to create a garden on a former brownfield site.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As usual, Monty is at Longmeadow where he will set out his plans for the coming year. Monty reviews the effects the winter weather has had on his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles seasonal jobs at Longmeadow and plants clematis in his cottage garden. Rachel de Thame takes a walk down memory lane when she visits the world's biggest flower garden in Holland and Carol Klein is on the trail of early plant hunters, responsible for the glorious selection of magnolias brought to these shores.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at RHS Garden Wisley in Surrey to learn from the experts there how easy alpines are to grow, which seeds are needed to plant a wildflower meadow and the best orchids to grow for each room in the house. Meanwhile, Carol Klein helps Britain in Bloom volunteer Michael Welsh, who is determined to bring colour to the former colliery town of Easington with a community garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a vine to grow dessert grapes and looks at varieties that can be grown outside as well as in a greenhouse. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at home in Glebe Cottage where she reveals a little of the fascinating history of one of our spring favourites, Trillium grandiflorum. Plus, Rachel de Thame explores a suburban, hidden garden with charms all of its own.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With bees in mind, Monty Don plans for spring by planting some early nectar sources for them, using bulbs which flower early in the year, namely crocus and winter aconites. He also selects some asters which will not only give colour for autumn but will also help bees build up their nectar reserves to help them survive the winter. Plus, Carol Klein is in Norfolk at Pensthorpe Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As summer marches on, Monty gets stuck into more seasonal jobs at Longmeadow. Adam Frost revels in the range of produce growing in a Victorian walled kitchen garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Arit Anderson discovers a paradise garden in Cambridge which has become a focal point for the local community, and Frances Tophill shares the joy of collecting and saving heirloom vegetable seeds on a visit to Pembrokeshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond celebrate the horticultural genius of William Robinson in the gardens of his former home, Gravetye Manor in Sussex. Fresh off the back of her success at Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival, Sue Kent gives her own garden some TLC and creates a special container display using small pots. There's also a passionate grower in London who uses every available space in his garden to grow a vast range of vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame and Arit Anderson explore the role gardeners can play in having a positive impact on wildlife in their gardens, allotments and communal green spaces. Nick Bailey meets an entomologist on a mission to change perceptions of common garden pests, Kate Bradbury shows how she gardens in harmony with wildlife on her allotment, and there's a look at a city garden where the wildlife is flourishing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After a short break, Monty's back at Longmeadow. With a change of seasons, he demonstrates how to prune summer fruiting raspberries, divides perennials and plants daffodils and hyacinths in containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants garlic, demonstrates how to divide crocosmia and sows ornamental grass seeds. Adam Frost visits Lowther Castle in the Lake District and finds out about its garden restoration project.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows us how to plant pots of bulbs for fabulous summer colour. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is out and about looking at native celandines, Wordsworth's favourite flower. They grace our hedgerows and woods at this time of year. The wild strains are too invasive for most domestic gardens, but Carol finds a number of cultivated varieties that should suit most of us.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don visits two sets of ambitious gardeners, each facing challenges on a very different scale. One is a tiny urban courtyard in Hackney and the other is a outdoor area for a community.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a vine to grow dessert grapes and looks at varieties that can be grown outside as well as in a greenhouse. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at home in Glebe Cottage where she reveals a little of the fascinating history of one of our spring favourites, Trillium grandiflorum. Plus, Rachel de Thame explores a suburban, hidden garden with charms all of its own.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As summer unfolds at Longmeadow, Monty Don undertakes timely tasks in his vegetable garden and flower beds. Meanwhile, Carol Klein enjoys the beauty of one of our unsung native flowers, the geum, and visits a cottage garden which holds the national collection of cultivated forms. Plus, Formula 1 supremo Sir Frank Williams explains why he is opening his garden at Inholmes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows us how to plant pots of bulbs for fabulous summer colour. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is out and about looking at native celandines, Wordsworth's favourite flower. They grace our hedgerows and woods at this time of year. The wild strains are too invasive for most domestic gardens, but Carol finds a number of cultivated varieties that should suit most of us.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the growing season picks up a pace, Monty is sowing vegetables and planting out the scented plants, which he brought back from the Malvern Spring Festival. Carol is delving into the hedgerows and rooting at the bases of walls, fences and trees as she begins her journey to investigate why plants thrive in challenging conditions. We also return to Sissinghurst to find out about the changes Troy Scott-Smith is making to the world famous white garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost shares the progress that's been made in his garden. Frances Tophill heads to the beach to reveal what gardeners can learn from the coastal plants which have evolved to cope with more extreme conditions.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.desc: With the local Key West ship wrecks covered in Permit, Rush takes good friend and marine artist KC Scott fishing for "inspiration." While permit is the plan, the boys stay rigged and ready for the numerous species the Florida Keys may deliver when fishing offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The most important fish catch is the one that got you hooked on fishing in the first place, and for many of us that catch happened early in life. On this episode Ali and Rush grab their favorite little fishing buddies for a great day on the water on their respective coasts. In Florida, Rush spends time with his son Kade fishing for huge permit while Ali takes his nephew Duke out for some wholesome yellowtail action in California.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway Livinia Nixon is setting sail down the mighty Douro river through Portugal. Discovering the historic city of Porto before cruising to ancient palaces, world class wineries and spectacular natural attractions.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway Livinia Nixon visits Spain’s golden city of Salamanca before winding up her cruise along the Douro river through Portugal.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle explores the Great Lakes on his Sea-Doo in search of walleye and lake trout.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny is joined by John McCune for blue line fishing with Tad Murdock. Later they explore Helen Georgia during Oktoberfest.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: As a child, Piotr Chara spent countless hours on the Oder River in Poland, fishing with his father and wondering at the wildlife; as he grew, Piotr noticed a decline in the river’s bird species and decided to take action. Now an award-winning photographer - and a father himself - Piotr runs an organization that builds floating nests for the birds and restores the rapidly receding wetlands.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: Nathalie Lasselin is a diver, filmmaker and activist who has explored everything from the Arctic to underwater caves in China; yet this River Hero finds herself pulled back to the waters of her home, Montreal, to help clean up the St. Lawrence River. Underwater, Lasselin and her team scuba dive to collect water samples for testing and scavenge for manmade debris, removing up to six tons of trash each year from a river that is the source of drinking water for so many Canadians.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In Episode 10 Boat Trader heads to central Texas to explore boating culture in the lone star state. Second only to Alaska in size, Texas is known as the place where everything is bigger. From big college football games to endless oil fields and vast wind farms, Texas is home to more than 30 million Americans. But the state is about more than just big oil, college football and cattle farms - it's also home to some of the best boating in the country. Boasting a myriad of waterways, boaters here enjoy hundreds of lakes, rivers and streams that provide recreational opportunities, abundant wildlife and plenty of fishing. From Austin Texas to San Antonio host Ryan McVinney and the Boat Trader crew explore the laid-back Texas lake life including boat up restaurants along the Colorado River, watersports in Austin and the history of the waterways throughout the region. Boat manufacturers highlighted in this episode are Tige Boats and ATX Surf Boats, two premium Texas-based wake boat brands known for their high-quality, cutting-edge vessels that come equipped with advanced wake shaping technologies and equipment ideal for water skiing, wake surfing and wakeboarding. There's even a wake surfing dog!

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark has knocked off all the waterfowl species for his Wingshooting Slam. Just two upland birds remain to complete the slam: Chukar and Pheasant. With a few days left in New Zealand, Mark starts his journey going after Chukar in the high country. He is accompanied by a local hunter who is taking him to an area where he has kicked a covey up in the past. They are in for a cold and brutal hike given the elevation and a storm moving in.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his quest on the Hearst Ranch in California. Next up on the list, California Aoudad. These Aoudad were introduced to the ranch in the early 1920s and have thrived ever since.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: In this episode of Goin' Coastal, Captain Josh and Anna Calhoon set out for some fun Flounder fishing. They enjoy a delicious hook & cook served up fresh from their day at AJ's!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Texas is the home to many exotic species that can be hunted. One species in particular, Axis, have a very large population. Our team got together and had a great time hanging out with a land owner and hunting Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Anyone can be a cowboy—that’s the biggest thing the DIRT crew learned in Texas. From riding bulls in Fort Worth to off-roading in the Chihuahuan desert to forging their own path across this vast state with the help of local trailblazers Liz and Lou Lambert. Lucky for us, they even stopped by Huckberry’s own backyard in Austin for a quick ruck and a couple games of chicken sh*t bingo. When the dust finally settled, we fired up the barbecue for our beefiest feast yet and raised our ranch waters high to 10 DIRT episodes in the can.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: It disappeared for generations and seasons on end, only to return again. This time, rivaling the golden era of the past. Explore the history of the beginning of sportfishing and how it has influenced the most prestigious anglers in Southern California.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff dive into the wild waters off Hawaii’s coast, coming face-to-face with sharks and graceful manta rays. The adrenaline peaks when Kyle takes a heart-pounding leap off a towering 40-foot cliff, making this adventure as daring as it is unforgettable.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff explore the breathtaking Waipio Valley, the Hawaiian "Valley of the Kings," in search of prawns and bullfrogs. Their adventure continues up a massive volcano, hunting invasive rams, before ending with a feast of native fish paired with island fruits and spices.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff hear about the dangers of fishing for Bluefin Tuna in the Atlantic Ocean from locals in Gloucester, Massachusetts. Then they head 30 miles out onto the open ocean with Darrin of Reel Respect Charters in the hopes of landing their own giant.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff team up with their friends from Boss Shotshells in South Dakota for a high-energy upland hunt, pursuing wild pheasants with the help of skilled hunting dogs. The adventure takes a quirky turn with a visit to the iconic Corn Palace.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team heads over to FGCI FiberGlass Coatings to learn about their innovative product, Paintable FiberGlass. This will be used to help touch up some scratches in the Taco Marine Project boat. We also receive very helpful maintenance tips to keep you running smoothly when out on the water.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team take a trip to Marine Surplus in order to gather miscellaneous parts for AquaSport project such as cleats, rod holders, and a rub rail getting them one step closer to finishing the project. The crew then heads back to the project were they get to work on installing the parts gathered and getting the AquaSport accessorized.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has made more daylight appearances than possibly any mature bucks in existence. Now that Slade is back from the midwest The chase is on.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, hunting season swiftly coming to an end. Withthe real estate world getting busier, Slade and his family set outto fill some tags, and fill up the freezer. It’s time to go on a DoePatrol!

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Three friends finally pack their bags and head west for the annual HuntStand pronghorn hunting camp—each with a unique goal in mind.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Notoriously nocturnal and living in some of the densest cover imaginable, the black-tailed deer is generally known to be more ghostly than the most challenging old whitetails.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Texas isn’t all mesquite flats, corn feeders, and wire fences. Some of the most extreme terrain in the country can be found in the Lone Star State, and it just so happens that hunting opportunities abound for the adventurous.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and part of the old Trained Assassins Crew, Luke Mitchell (producer) and Ryan Wascom (host), head out to Colorado to chase bugling elk with their bows. Also joining the crew is one of Slade’s real estate clients and his son. Part of the deal when this client worked with Slade was that Slade lined them up an elk hunt the following fall. It is an amazing week at camp with five arrows being sent down range and multiple elk hitting the dirt. You do not want to miss this one.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are back in Missouri on our new farm that we’ve recently purchased. We developed our last farm, and did a 1031 tax free exchange to buy this farm so we can develop and sell it later on. This is the first time we’ve seen the property, so we are finding out what we are going to do with it and how we are going to lay it out. Once we get that figured out, we go into the dirty work of planting, moving box stands, and making sure everything is good for hunting season. Fast forward and we have two amazing hunts where both Ryan and myself take awesome bucks with our bows. This one has it all! Do not miss it!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are super busy juggling the turkey season opener, but we also have our real estate convention in Gulf Shores Alabama, multiple listing videos to complete, and property showings. It happens every year to us, spring kicks off and people want to have properties of their own knowing dog gone well it’s the most wonderful time of the year. TURKEY SEASON! It’s a jam up of a week. You’re not going to want to miss it.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Aoudad Country Part 2- Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things hunting head to the Texas and Mexico border on a DIY Aoudad hunt where Cole is after his first Aoudad. After that Kyle teams up with good friend Chris Griffin where they head to another Ranch on the border and hunt two giant Aoudad rams with a rifles.

programme.title: Browning Films

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didn’t just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys – and more importantly, the way we hunt them.

Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Capt Josh and Johnny from Johnny Jigs head out with gorgeous weather on their side to hit some reefs and put the jigs to work!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Captain Josh and the fam head out to do some surf fishing to see what’s biting. Then ended the day building professional sand castles and playing goofy golf.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the local Key West ship wrecks covered in Permit, Rush takes good friend and marine artist KC Scott fishing for "inspiration." While permit is the plan, the boys stay rigged and ready for the numerous species the Florida Keys may deliver when fishing offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The most important fish catch is the one that got you hooked on fishing in the first place, and for many of us that catch happened early in life. On this episode Ali and Rush grab their favorite little fishing buddies for a great day on the water on their respective coasts. In Florida, Rush spends time with his son Kade fishing for huge permit while Ali takes his nephew Duke out for some wholesome yellowtail action in California.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor meet up with Captain Nick LaBadie at Big Pine Key for an action packed day on the flats chasing tarpon, bonefish and permit for the elusive grand slam.

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor run from Hawks Cay Resort up to Islamorada on a windy day to fish under the mangroves for Goliath grouper.
